post.title: "I love winter, it's just free carrots in every garden."

body:
I've noticed this as well. I noticed that just a picture of a fox does not get much attention; only if the picture is outstanding or uncommon in some way it will receive significant upvotes. So a fox stealing a carrot from a snowman will receive more rep than a generic image of a fox that's just walking. A picture of a grey fox sleeping on someone's car is more upvote-worthy than a fox sleeping in a forest somewhere, because it isn't common.

That's the main reason, but another important factor is probably just luck.

post.title: "I love winter, it's just free carrots in every garden."

body:
Foxes are in fact omnivores with a highly varied diet.

The diet of a red fox consists primarily of meat, and they prey on a lot of small mammals such as voles, mice, squirrels, and hamsters. Sometimes they go after larger animals like birds (primarily perching birds, chickens, and ducks), porcupines, raccoons, and opossums, and also reptiles, insects, and fish. Rarely, they may attack young or small ungulates, such as deer.

But it's not just meat. Red foxes are known to eat a variety of plants, and in some areas, their entire diet may consist of fruit during autumn. They eat berries, grapes, persimmon, plums, and acorns.

When hunting small mammals that burrow beneath snow, they locate their prey by sound using their highly sensitive ears, and then attack with their [iconic pounce](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dP15zlyra3c).

Most fox species have similar diets, except for arctic foxes which eat almost exclusively meat and eggs, but also berries and seaweed, if they can find it. Fennec foxes are notable because they don't need to drink water, despite being native to the Sahara - their food (which consists of rodents, lizards, geckos, skinks, small birds and their eggs, fruits, and some tubers) contains all the water they need, and their bodies are very efficient in using the water they get.

(Source: Wikipedia)
body_html:
Foxes are in fact omnivores with a highly varied diet.

The diet of a red fox consists primarily of meat, and they prey on a lot of small mammals such as voles, mice, squirrels, and hamsters. Sometimes they go after larger animals like birds (primarily perching birds, chickens, and ducks), porcupines, raccoons, and opossums, and also reptiles, insects, and fish. Rarely, they may attack young or small ungulates, such as deer.

But it's not just meat. Red foxes are known to eat a variety of plants, and in some areas, their entire diet may consist of fruit during autumn. They eat berries, grapes, persimmon, plums, and acorns.

When hunting small mammals that burrow beneath snow, they locate their prey by sound using their highly sensitive ears, and then attack with their iconic pounce.

Most fox species have similar diets, except for arctic foxes which eat almost exclusively meat and eggs, but also berries and seaweed, if they can find it. Fennec foxes are notable because they don't need to drink water, despite being native to the Sahara - their food (which consists of rodents, lizards, geckos, skinks, small birds and their eggs, fruits, and some tubers) contains all the water they need, and their bodies are very efficient in using the water they get.

(Source: Wikipedia)

body:
Yeah but even your generic pics usually get like 30 upvotes in an hour. I and a few others post a lot of interesting images too and they still only get a lot of upvotes occasionally, usually only a small amount, whereas you get them every time it seems. I think we even get them from the same sources since you're the one who shared them with me. There's gotta be something you're doing differently, as you naturally do with literally everything it seems. Do you have like a 300 IQ or something?

If it really is all just luck, then why does it always strike the same people the same way all the time?

If it really is all just luck, then why does it always strike the same people the same way all the time?

body:
What you're seeing is affected by confirmation bias, and the fact that recent posts have been doing significantly better, on this guild at large.

Selection of your posts:
- [1 hour ago, 20 points, I expect it to get to 40 within a few hours](https://ruqqus.com/post/2xtj/this-is-the-prettiest-plant-ive)
- [4 hours ago, 46 points](https://ruqqus.com/post/2xkw/-floof)
- [2 days ago, 57 points](https://ruqqus.com/post/2v9z/nose-covered-in-snow)

Selection of my posts:
- [4 days ago, 20 points](https://ruqqus.com/post/2s9z/fox-in-zao-fox-village-japan)
- [6 days ago, 24 points](https://ruqqus.com/post/2ppd/too-many-to-count)
- [8 days ago, 16 points](https://ruqqus.com/post/2nuu/foxes-playing-in-the-snow)

body:
You picked out your lowest scored posts, and my highest scored ones. Your others are usually 40-60 points, and get more than 20 in the first hour. I don't get > 30 almost every day that I post something.

If I do the same thing, this is the result:

Selection of your posts:

* [23 hours ago, 46 points](https://ruqqus.com/post/2wsv/i-love-winter-its-just-free)
* [1 day ago, 53 points](https://ruqqus.com/post/2vly/pounce)
* [3 days ago, 60 points](https://ruqqus.com/post/2u42/did-you-say-treats-d)
* [11 days ago, 43 points](https://ruqqus.com/post/2ieq/face-covered-in-snow)
* [14 days ago, 43 points](https://ruqqus.com/post/2fwl/fox-dozing-off-in-the-sun)
* [14 days ago, 47 points](https://ruqqus.com/post/2ero/you-treats-now)

My posts:

* [2 hours ago, 21 points](https://ruqqus.com/post/2xtj/this-is-the-prettiest-plant-ive)
* [2 hours ago, 11 points](https://ruqqus.com/post/2xtf/fox-standing-up)
* [23 hours ago, 21 points](https://ruqqus.com/post/2wrt/treats-d)
* [1 day ago, 33 points](https://ruqqus.com/post/2wi2/nom)
* [2 days ago, 17 points](https://ruqqus.com/post/2ufs/newborn-fox-kit-)
* [5 days ago, 11 points](https://ruqqus.com/post/2qzj/happy-fox-getting-scritches)
* [7 days ago, 22 points](https://ruqqus.com/post/2p0g/red-fox-sleeping-peacfully-on-someones)
* [9 days ago, 22 points](https://ruqqus.com/post/2kt9/super-fox-bros)
* [10 days ago, 24 points](https://ruqqus.com/post/2k6u/foxxo-eating-a-popsicle)
* [10 days ago, 8 points](https://ruqqus.com/post/2jju/-)

Keep in mind that I make more posts on average. While I do have a few posts in the 40-60 range, the vast majority of them aren't. In your case most of them do make it to there, save for the 3 posts you referenced which were from an "off" week.

I feel like you're naturally able to make yours more attractive to viewers scrolling through the site; I find them more attention-worthy myself. But I have trouble doing that for some reason even if I try on purpose. No matter what I do I can never put anything together that "clicks" [I edited this in after writing the rest of this comment. After this is mostly just me venting and probably isn't something you can help me with. I don't want to bother or bore you with it, so feel free to stop reading here.], and this is the case for everything I try to do, from the simplest to the largest things. That's my biggest problem in life I think, I've always dealt with it, and it's killing pretty much everything I ever try to accomplish. Probably I lack the natural ability to do so, so I resort to thinking too hard about stuff and it doesn't work. It's some kind of a massive mental block that covers all different fields and I have no idea what to do about it. It wasn't always there, I think it began about a decade ago and intensified as time went on. This is probably why I have so much creative drive, even though I no longer have the ability.
body_html:
You picked out your lowest scored posts, and my highest scored ones. Your others are usually 40-60 points, and get more than 20 in the first hour. I don't get > 30 almost every day that I post something.

If I do the same thing, this is the result:

  • 23 hours ago, 46 points
  • 1 day ago, 53 points
  • 3 days ago, 60 points
  • 11 days ago, 43 points
  • 14 days ago, 43 points
  • 14 days ago, 47 points

My posts:

  • 2 hours ago, 21 points
  • 2 hours ago, 11 points
  • 23 hours ago, 21 points
  • 1 day ago, 33 points
  • 2 days ago, 17 points
  • 5 days ago, 11 points
  • 7 days ago, 22 points
  • 9 days ago, 22 points
  • 10 days ago, 24 points
  • 10 days ago, 8 points

Keep in mind that I make more posts on average. While I do have a few posts in the 40-60 range, the vast majority of them aren't. In your case most of them do make it to there, save for the 3 posts you referenced which were from an "off" week.

I feel like you're naturally able to make yours more attractive to viewers scrolling through the site; I find them more attention-worthy myself. But I have trouble doing that for some reason even if I try on purpose. No matter what I do I can never put anything together that "clicks" [I edited this in after writing the rest of this comment. After this is mostly just me venting and probably isn't something you can help me with. I don't want to bother or bore you with it, so feel free to stop reading here.], and this is the case for everything I try to do, from the simplest to the largest things. That's my biggest problem in life I think, I've always dealt with it, and it's killing pretty much everything I ever try to accomplish. Probably I lack the natural ability to do so, so I resort to thinking too hard about stuff and it doesn't work. It's some kind of a massive mental block that covers all different fields and I have no idea what to do about it. It wasn't always there, I think it began about a decade ago and intensified as time went on. This is probably why I have so much creative drive, even though I no longer have the ability.

body:
And I suppose the moral of the story here is to not take these things so seriously, because you never know when you'll wake up the next day and Heroku will have banned ruqqus and all the upvotes were lost in the database transfer anyway.

Although for me it's more about making good posts than how many upvotes it actually gets. And upvotes are an indicator of quality.
body_html:
And I suppose the moral of the story here is to not take these things so seriously, because you never know when you'll wake up the next day and Heroku will have banned ruqqus and all the upvotes were lost in the database transfer anyway.

Although for me it's more about making good posts than how many upvotes it actually gets. And upvotes are an indicator of quality.
